title: New: Silence Dogood – Granola Kids
content:
Lo-fi appears to be all the rage at the moment, and Michigan’s Silence Dogood appear very much like they’ve been brought up solely on a diet of Slanted And Enchanted and 90’s Americana, nothing wrong with that though.

Their debut track Granola Kids sounds like it’s been recorded on a toaster; fuzzy vocals, deliriously imperfect guitars and a huge serving of genuine teenage angst/humour. In fact, Granola Kids may not seem it from the off, but it’s lyrically inspired – “Neon girls who don’t react, sign electronic suicide pacts” and my personal favourite, “What’s my Muslim name today? I invent religious holidays. We resurrected Kurt Cobain, housebreaking all his dusty cliches”. Sublime.
author: 5e9b68b27a1236eccfeb1d27
